rev.diff:
Line 220: Line 220:
In 2007, it was announced that IBM would contribute some of the code it had developed for the integration of the OpenOffice.org suite into Lotus Notes 8 back to the project<ref>[http://symphony.lotus.com/software/lotus/symphony/buzzentry.jspa?selectedCategoryID=5&threadID=2191&tstart=0 "IBM Joins OpenOffice.org Community"]</ref>. IBM also packaged its version of Open Office for free distribution as IBM Lotus Symphony, released in beta mode on September 17<ref>[http://symphony.lotus.com/software/lotus/symphony/buzzentry.jspa?selectedCategoryID=5&threadID=2581&tstart=0 "IBM Releases Office Desktop Software at No Charge to Foster Collaboration and Innovation"]</ref>.
In 2007, it was announced that IBM would contribute some of the code it had developed for the integration of the OpenOffice.org suite into Lotus Notes 8 back to the project<ref>[http://symphony.lotus.com/software/lotus/symphony/buzzentry.jspa?selectedCategoryID=5&threadID=2191&tstart=0 "IBM Joins OpenOffice.org Community"]</ref>. IBM also packaged its version of Open Office for free distribution as IBM Lotus Symphony, released in beta mode on September 17<ref>[http://symphony.lotus.com/software/lotus/symphony/buzzentry.jspa?selectedCategoryID=5&threadID=2581&tstart=0 "IBM Releases Office Desktop Software at No Charge to Foster Collaboration and Innovation"]</ref>.
â
At [[Lotusphere]] 2008, it was announced that Notes/Domino 8.0.1 would ship during February 2008<ref>[http://www.edbrill.com/ebrill/edbrill.nsf/dx/introducing-my-widgets-in-notes-8.0.1 Blog entry by Ed Brill at IBM about Notes 8.0.1]</ref>, with 8.0.2 coming in the summer. Version 8.5, which includes a Mac client, support for [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] 7.10 in addition to Red Hat and Suse, as well as a Eclipse-based Domino Designer, will be available during the second half of 2008, according to IBM<ref>[http://www-03.ibm.com/press/us/en/pressrelease/23370.wss IBM Press Release about Ubuntu support]</ref>.
+
At [[Lotusphere]] 2008, it was announced that Notes/Domino 8.0.1 would ship during February 2008<ref>[http://www.edbrill.com/ebrill/edbrill.nsf/dx/introducing-my-widgets-in-notes-8.0.1 Blog entry by Ed Brill at IBM about Notes 8.0.1]</ref>, with 8.0.2 coming in the summer. Version 8.5, which includes a Mac client, support for [[Ubuntu (operating system)|ubuntu]] 7.10 in addition to Red Hat and Suse, as well as a Eclipse-based Domino Designer, will be available during the second half of 2008, according to IBM<ref>[http://www-03.ibm.com/press/us/en/pressrelease/23370.wss IBM Press Release about Ubuntu support]</ref>.
